meanings.definition: To engage in a physical struggle or fight.
meanings.sent1: The siblings would often rassle playfully in the living room.
meanings.sent2: The wrestlers will rassle in the ring for the championship title.
meanings.sent3: During the picnic, the kids decided to rassle over the last piece of cake.
meanings.sent4: The two teams will rassle fiercely for victory on the field.
meanings.sent5: The warriors rassle with all their might in the ancient battle.

meanings.sent1: The dog and the cat got into a noisy rassle in the backyard.
meanings.sent2: The rassle between the two wrestlers was intense and exciting to watch.
meanings.sent3: The rassle between the siblings for the TV remote ended with laughter.
meanings.sent4: The rassle between good and evil is a timeless theme in literature.
meanings.sent5: The rassle between the rival gangs caused chaos in the neighborhood.
